topic.title: How to Use Asian Fonts in Linux

indexterm.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

body.p:
For Asian languages on Linux distributions, PDF Chemistry automatically uses DejaVu and Noto CJK as fallback fonts for both Serif, Sans-Serif, and Monospace contents.On some distributions, the Noto CJK fonts are not available, in this case you need to install them using the system package manager:
fonts-noto-cjk on Debian family distributions (e.g. Ubuntu).
google-noto-cjk-fonts on Red Hat family distributions (e.g. CentOS).
